STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 13, 2022
Kathleen Schultz
Wellspring Lutheran Services Oak Park
25900 Greenfield Suit 401
Oak Park, MI 48237
RE: License #: CB630201261
Wellspring Lutheran Services Oak Park
25900 Greenfield Suit 401
Oak Park, MI 48237
Dear Ms. Schultz:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 07/12/2022.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Settlement Agreement (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is required.
It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 An explanation why previous corrective action plans have not
obtained and maintained compliance for rules found in repeat non-
compliance.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
Enclosure
Rebecca Yowell
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for
each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal
and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
In eighteen service plans reviewed, one service plan dated 2/25/22 – 5/25/22,
was generated on 5/26/22 was 1 day late.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL 2021
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS
DHHS will maintain an operational statewide automated
child welfare information system (MiSACWIS) which will
be the primary tracking system and satisfy federal
reporting requirements.
Reports need to be uploaded timely, PATP’s, updated service
plans, borrowed bed agreements, training logs, report cards
and updated medical passports.
4

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
DHHS Policy Required Participation in Development - Foster Parent /
FOM 722-08C Caregiver
Page 2
The individual activities required by the foster
parent/caregiver to meet the specific individual needs of
the child placed in their home are included in the PATP.
The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP
process. The foster parent/caregiver signature is required
and indicates that the foster parent/caregiver
acknowledges and agrees to the activities required to meet
the needs of the child in their care. Additionally, the PATP
details the services and activities provided by the foster
care worker to assist the foster parent/caregiver in caring
for the child.
In one of six foster child records reviewed, one record dated 11/27/21 –
2/24/22 was signed on 4/27/22 pass the 30 days per policy.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL 2021
DHHS POLICY Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary
FOM 722-08E
Completion Requirements:
The caseworker must complete the DHS – 69,
Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary,
and upload to MiSACWIS within the timeframe
required for the specified change. Within three business
days of foster care or juvenile justice program or
case closure.
In one of two closed foster child records reviewed, one did not show documentation of
the DHS-69 for the child’s case closure.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL 2021
5

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 R400.12409 EDUCATION POLICY – Provide report cards
 R400.12413 MEDICAL AND DENTAL CARE POLICY - Update medical
passports as needed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency received an investigation on the foster home SI#2022C0630127on
10/7/21 regarding the foster parent hitting the foster children in her home. The
foster parent was found in violation with Rule 9404 Behavior Management (3) Foster
parent shall not use corporal punishment. Upon completion of the investigation, the
agency found the foster parent in violation with the rule and recommended
revocation due to being willful and substantial.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan for their renewal
evaluation dated 05/7/21. The agency was found in non-compliance with Rules 306
(3a-3I), 306 (4), 312, 324, 326, 327, 405,413, 418, 420, 422, ISEP 4.22, ISEP 6.49,
FOM POLICY 722.6B, 722.08B, AND 722.8E. The agency has worked hard to
correct their non-compliances and it really showed in this evaluation. However, the
agency had some repeat violations for this evaluation.
VII. DCWL ANALYST FINDINGS:
There were no safety issues.
6

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend Wellspring Lutheran Services that
the facility continue on a regular license.
07/13/2022
________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 14, 2022
________________________________________
Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
